there's a lot of that kind of technology

looking at the weather to decide how

the problem with that if you're one of
those workers is it's very hard to plan

second job makes it hard to go to school
at night so you're kind of trapped in in
this kind of problem area and so my
reaction to that was it seemed like
techno
was being used to basically screw the

let me define wage theft because in a
previous talk somebody came back and
said I don't know what wage theft is
please explain it so if you work certain
number of hours and don't get paid for
all those hours that's wage theft if you
work overtime and don't get paid the
correct overtime rate that's wage theft
if you work for tips and are sent to the
back storeroom to clean it out or
rearrange it and can't collect tips
while you're working that's wage stuff
so there are all kinds of varieties of
wage theft the most recent example being
Domino's and this is dominos corporate
their payroll system actually
systematically shorted people on their
pay so the New York State Attorney
General is going after them I hope the
Illinois Attorney General Lisa Madigan
does the same thing because that's a
huge amount of money so it's estimated
that wage theft is about a 50 billion
dollar problem in the United States so
that that's a huge amount of money if
and thinking from an economist
standpoint if you could reintroduce that
money to those workers give them money
that they actually earned that would be
a 50 billion dollar stimulus to the
economy every year which would be huge
so that that's kind of the thinking
behind that this chart relates to a UIC
study that was done several years ago
where they looked at very low wage
hourly workers they brought them in had
to bring their pay stubs and other
documentation and
if they were paid properly and as you
can see from the chart this is for the
prior week sixty-seven percent of those
workers weren't properly paid for
overtime if they worked overtime so that
just the prior week which just boggled

an issue and the the idea or the the the
